item.value: The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
Sneezing with your eyes open is impossible
The launch of the Russian Spiknit 1 spcecraft started the 'space race' between Russia and America. Explorer 1 was the first spacecraft launched by the United States on 31 January 1958.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
The South Pole is the least sunny placeon earth with only 182 days a year off sunshine
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
